recipesJson.name: Boosted v3
recipesJson.author: ENYAWREKLAW
recipesJson.description:
NOTES:

Seems to be missing a bit of that "frosted milk / dairy / buttery / meringue-y / somethingness". But everything else seems to be on point.

reviews.text: A good balance of strawberries and cream. It's nice from the shake, better after the 3 day recommended steep.

This is a great S&C recipe. With an overabundance of this profile out there, all tasting so similar, it's refreshing to find one that is apart from the herd. I have had plenty of the original (it was one of my ADVs before I got into DIY) and I have to say this is better. I didn't have TPA Strawberry at first, so I subbed it with Strawberry Ripe which worked quite well up until I got Strawberry from BCF. I'm not sure which ingredient I like better so I just alternate to keep it fresh. I usually keep a 120ml at the ready, but it's good off the shake if I neglect my mixing responsibilities and have to SNV to get my fix. That being said, I prefer to wait for a 5 day steep.
To the point up front strong strawberryness followed by some creamyness ! very nice indeedy.
Damn Wayne this is better than boosted. I passed a few months ago because Iâ€™m not a huge fan of cap sweet strawberry but this works better than I imagined it would. Glad I finally mixed it up.
This reminds me alot of my favorite strawberry & cream which is Cheebas. The NY Cheesecake work really well it add a unique taste. Your SB combo works great and pairs well with your cream choices
This shit is bangin, even right off the shake. It's better than Mustard Milk by a long shot.
